description:
'''Slowcore'''{{efn|name=Spelling differences}} (also known as '''sadcore''') is a [[subgenre]] of [[indie rock]] characterized by its subdued tempos, minimalist instrumentation, and sombre vocal performances. The style was originally pioneered by artists such as [[Galaxie 500]], [[Low (band)|Low]], [[Codeine (band)|Codeine]], [[Red House Painters]], [[Spain (band)|Spain]], [[Duster (band)|Duster]], [[Ida (band)|Ida]] and [[Bedhead (band)|Bedhead]], while primarily drawing influences from [[dream pop]], [[folk rock|folk]] and [[alternative rock]]. 

In the 21st century, the genre saw wider popularization with acts such as [[Hope Sandoval & the Warm Inventions]], [[Grouper (musician)|Grouper]], and [[Sun Kil Moon]].
